Episodes.Title: The World Intrudes
Episodes.Plot: Hamish Keith looks back at New Zealand?s earliest art, the rock drawings of the South Islands and the impact they had on 20th century artists.
Episodes.ParentalRatingReason: Lightbox Provisional Classification. Official NZ Rating To Be Confirmed.

Episodes.Title: Engaging With Difference
Episodes.Plot: How travelling artists like Augustus Earle and George French Angus engaged with Maori and Maori society and were fascinated by difference. How Maori art responded positively to European impact and flourished with new technologies and new challenges.
Episodes.ParentalRatingReason: Lightbox Provisional Classification. Official NZ Rating To Be Confirmed.

Episodes.Title: Civilising
Episodes.Plot: Were New Zealand?s Victorians dull and repressed or were they exciting innovators laying the foundations for a flourishing and inventive metropolitan society? Victorian architecture might have been our only golden age.
Episodes.ParentalRatingReason: Lightbox Provisional Classification. Official NZ Rating To Be Confirmed.

Episodes.Title: Reinventing Distance
Episodes.Plot: After a promising start New Zealand culture takes a wrong turn. The country turns its back on the Tasman world it had belonged to from the very beginning of European settlement and snuggles up to an imaginary Britain.
Episodes.ParentalRatingReason: Lightbox Provisional Classification. Official NZ Rating To Be Confirmed.

Episodes.Title: In Search of the New
Episodes.Plot: New Zealanders. Maori and Pakeha all come from somewhere else and all New Zealanders treasure memories of the cultures from which they came.
Episodes.ParentalRatingReason: Lightbox Provisional Classification. Official NZ Rating To Be Confirmed.

Episodes.Title: The Braided River
Episodes.Plot: A confident New Zealand art adapts influences from the whole world of art to make something of their own. Sculpture heralds the beginning of an urban art.
Episodes.ParentalRatingReason: Lightbox Provisional Classification. Official NZ Rating To Be Confirmed.
